body: @harupy what version of mlflow is this?
@harupy Thank you! This should solve our issue.
@tanmaymathur89 I think you can use this feature in the older versions.
@harupy this made me realize that it actually plot two different curves in the same graph but it should be a one curve for a parameter.
Currently, it's not possible to plot metrics that belong to different runs as one curve.

Would it be possible in your use-case to update the metrics for the existing run, using the [MlflowClient API](https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.tracking.html)? Just wondering if this would avoid the need for special UI treatment to merge metrics from multiple runs together.

@aarondav The reason we don't update the existing run is because it overwrites our workflow metadata too that are saved as tags in the run. 
Are there any alternatives to store workflow metadata and job metrics for multiple prediction runs?
